discussion.content: Remember to be familiar with common industry lingo such as RJ45 and understand it so that you are more effective on the exam and able to talk like a professional. Nothing is more annoying than two techs talking about the same thing but misunderstanding each other because they are using different terms and set up for confusion.

Selected Answer: D
Ethernet

Selected Answer: D
D. is the correct answer. They could be more specific, but it doesn't matter. This is right.
Ethernet is the best choice. Comptia should change the answer from from ethernet cable to patch cable.
correct. ethernet cable
So what it the correct answer
Ethernet isn't a cable - it's a protocol. CCNA drives this home. Regardless, it's the correct answer based on industry lingo.

comments.content: What do you call the cable that connects the switch and/or router to the computer then?

STP (shielded twisted pair) or UTP (unshielded twisted pair) there are 2 standards 568a and 568b depending which devices you connect you use different cables
some will call it by Cat5, Cat6 etc. depending on the cable itself
They are most famously used for the Ethernet communication protocol and that is what most people will call it - Ethernet cable

questions.question_text: Which of the following cable types should be used to connect a cable modem to a SOHO router?
Which of the following requires less current to provide the same amount of power to devices inside a PC?

discussion.content: Where the hell in the book is this?

[question asks which “requires less current to provide the same amount of power” -- Watts = Volts x Amps] 
[suppose we have a constant “A” (amps, “current”) = 10, then see below]
Not (A) 5.5 * 10 = 50.5 watts of power
Not (B) 12 * 10 = 120 watts of power
Not (C) 120 + 10 = 1200 watts of power
D – 220V -- 220 * 10 = 2200 watts of power [so you could reduce the current by half and still get the same power]
My first thought was C, 12V. and when I asked further, I got an explanation that selected B as the answer. 12V, Commonly used in PCs for various components such as fans, hard drives, and peripherals.

At a higher voltage, less current is necessary w = V * A.
Electric consumption (W)

A and B is too little voltage to power all internal "devices".
C is enough but can't power less voltage.
D can provide more Volts than C AND match 120v if it needs to. 
ANS = D.
There is no 220V inside a PC. AC 110/220V are outside voltages from the power grid, depending on the country. Inside PC are only DC +3.3V, -+5V, -+12V

comments.content: This is the key phrase here "to devices INSIDE a PC". 220v provides power to the PSU. the 5v and 12v rails provide power to devices inside the PC. Out of the 2 the 12V rail needs less current (amps) to provide the pame power output (Watts). 220V gives the MOST power of the options given but just try hooking internal components up to a 220V source and see what it smells like

discussion.content: I did not know there was 220 volts INSIDE a PC? Are there PC fans that run on 220v? Is this a special video card that runs on 220V?
Power=voltage x current
To devices INSIDE the PC. So I was concerned, maybe INSIDE the PC is 12V? Not 220V for PSU?

Note that it is saying headset not headphones. Headsets have attached microphones and are more used on PCs and Gaming Systems. Headphones can have an integrated microphone, but its usually not visible or offers the same quality. Headphones are just used for audio (in most cases), some headsets use a 305mm headphone jack as well, but PC dedicated quality headsets will commonly have a USB
I have an old set of headphones with a USB connector.
A headset typically consists of headphones and a mic, with a USB connector
I've never seen a pair of headphones with a USB connector. Where do I get one?

comments.content: A few years ago yes (although as i remember they often came with a split cable with 1 connection for headphones and one for mic), nowadays a USB headset is frequently part of the standard issue kit for a new office employee. Less frequently found at home but in a work environment an everyday piece of equipment.
Pretty much any gaming headset. But usually you would expect a 1/8" headphone jack for a normal setup. This exam is all kinds of whack.
And that, my good man, is the key to the whole game.

discussion.content: not typical solution but only 1 logical here

questions.question_text: Which of the following is used to connect a headset to a laptop?

An end user reports a Windows based PC just had a BSOD. The PC rebooted, and the user is now logged back in and working without any issues. Which of the following should a technician check FIRST to begin troubleshooting?

comments.content: I agree and to add to that, every time a BSOD occurs, important information will be written in the event log. Best to check that out first

discussion.content: I think event viewer is the correct answer because something other than a bad driver may have caused the BSOD
@kyogen, Good for Mike Meyers I love that guy!! :)
Mike Meyers from Udemy said that when having bsod issue, the device manager should be the one to check because the cause might be the bad drivers.

comments.content: It seems like a bit of a logical leap to assume the BSOD in this question is due to a bad driver. Check event viewer to see what cased the crash.

questions.question_text: A user calls the help desk stating a laptop is performing slowly and the hard drive activity lights are blinking continuously. A technician checks for enough hard drive space, disables antivirus and indexing services, and runs a full-system diagnostics check, which returns no failure. Which of the following should the technician do NEXT?

discussion.content:
First: Yes for sure, there are firmware updates for Storage Devices (HDD, SDD, etc.) … and there are a lot.

And Secondly all other answers are finally not the best solution, wasting money or finally ar not solving the issue.

Firmware Update is the correct solution here.

comments.content: Check you're manufacturer's page for your computer. I guarantee there will be at least 1 firmware update for storage since you bought it.
What's your point? I thought that was why we were here, because we don't know and wish to learn?
You are definitely a ROOKIE if you've never heard of firmware for hdd's.

discussion.content: How the hell is it B? I have never heard of firmware updates for a storage drive.

A key statement, that would rule out A, and C is that the user CALLS the helpdesk. I take this to mean the tech is not present. So, E is out as well as that cant be done by a tech remotely and why would he/she? D is also out as Power and performance are about how the computer should act as far as power plans and sleep modes. Leaving B as the most viable answer.
best answer here should be defrag the disk, who this exact symptom. Slow and blinking hdd

comments.content: "should be" conditional form. Do you know basic grammar?
Since "defrag the disk" wasn't an option, it's NOT the "best answer here."

discussion.content: I do not believe firmware update will change performance. I would upgrade to SSD.
Sounds more like a RAM issue. Continuous HD activity, slow PC, accessing the swap or paging file?

comments.content: In the real sounds like a nice easy solution but the question was what does the technician do NEXT. Checking for firmware updates is quicker, doesn't require backing up or transferring the user's data and could solve the problem without any additional cost. You'd usually be expected to try to find the cause of the problem first before just replacing parts and hoping.

discussion.content: In real life I would just purchase a $30 SSD for a user.

D. Configure the laptop in high-performance mode
[Question says “laptop is performing slowly “ – best immediate solution to improve performance is configure high-performance mode -- If you turn on high performance mode option it improves the performance up to 6%]
https://answers.yahoo.com/question/index?qid=20140211033336AAyEuiz

comments.content: To my understanding, this article says that firmware update is not available for Sata and Ata hard disk. Updates are usually available for some USB external hard disk drives.

discussion.content: https://www.seagate.com/support/kb/does-my-drive-need-a-firmware-update-206091en/
Me neither.

choices.E: Change the boot order in the system BIOS
choices.C: Replace the hard drive with a solid state drive
choices.D: Configure the laptop in high-performance mode
